cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles west of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Currently moving north-northwest, forecast to turn north tonight and then accelerate north-northeast on Wednesday, tracking across northern Florida, Georgia and the Carolinas before skirting the Mid-Atlantic coast toward New England and Atlantic Canada.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north Florida Gulf Coast (near the Big Bend/Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from the mouth of St. Marys River, GA/FL border, to South Santee River, SC (no watches yet issued farther north).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning along the Florida Keys and Florida’s west coast from Flamingo to the Ochlockonee River; Hurricane Watch from Egmont Key to Steinhatchee River, FL.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from Florida Panhandle through the Carolinas to New England, including Delaware Bay and the New Jersey–Pennsylvania coast.
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Thursday night into Friday; gusty 20–30 mph winds more likely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in the Delaware River; minor tidal departures (<1 ft) possible along the nearby New Jersey coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Friday, locally up to 4 inches in heavy bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado threat Friday; hazardous seas and rip currents along the New Jersey coast could disrupt vessel traffic.
